title: Computing modular polynomials by deformation
abstract:
We present an unconditional CRT algorithm to compute the modular polynomial
$\Phi_\ell(X,Y)$ in quasi-linear time. The main ingredients of our algorithm
are: the embedding of $\ell$-isogenies in smooth-degree isogenies in higher
dimension, and the computation of $m$-th order deformations of isogenies. We
provide a proof-of-concept implementation of a heuristic version of the
algorithm demonstrating the practicality of our approach.
  Our algorithm can also be used to compute the reduction of $\Phi_{\ell}$
modulo $p$ in quasi-linear time (with respect to $\ell$) $\tilde{O}(\ell^2(\log
p + \log \ell)^{\mathfrak{O}})$.
